abstract: New Jersey, under guidance of Gov Chris Christie, agreed in 2011 to accept just $5 million of $30 million in taxes owed by casinos founded by Donald Trump that state had been pursuing for years; while tax authorities sometimes settle for lesser amounts in order to avoid further costs involved with litigation, size of discount and longtime friendship between Christie and Trump  raises questions about special treatment.
lead_paragraph: Under Gov. Chris Christie, New Jersey agreed to accept just $5 million in the bankruptcy cases of casinos founded by his friend Donald J. Trump, raising questions of special treatment.
snippet: Under Gov. Chris Christie, New Jersey agreed to accept just $5 million in the bankruptcy cases of casinos founded by his friend Donald J. Trump, raising questions of special treatment....

headline.main: Trump Casinos’ Tax Debt Was $30 Million. Then Christie Took Office.
headline.print_headline: Trump Casinos Got Break on Tax Bill Under Christie
